comments:
When I try generating build scripts for the org.eclipse.platform.sdk feature (headless), I get the following NPE:

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.create30SourceFragment(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:1356)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generateSourceFragment(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:1085)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generateSourceFeature(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:1065)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generate(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:231)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generateIncludedFeatureBuildFile(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:284)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generate(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:229)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BuildScriptGenerator.generateFeatures(BuildScriptGenerator.java:168)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BuildScriptGenerator.generate(BuildScriptGenerator.java:80)


I had entered bug 128129 originally, but discovered a different stack trace when I checked the log on the build machine.(                                                             4959,1-8
I tried to build the platform.sdk itself and it succeeded. Need more context or the build machine.

It seems related to the fact that the org.eclipse.platform.source feature and plug-in have already been generated in the course of the org.eclipse.sdk feature build.  I can reproduce the failure by generating scripts for the org.eclipse.sdk feature followed by script generation for org.eclipse.platform.sdk.

Part of the problem was caused by bug #128297.
However there is still a problem if a build that generates source plugins using timestamp as a qualifier is run without deleting the soruce plugin generated in the previous run.
It looks like the source plugin created in the second run is not resolved in the state and therefore the attachement of the fragment fails.
We need to see if we want to fix for 3.2 since this problem has always been here.
This should now be fixed as part of the fix for bug 127726.
